results.title: While you were sleeping
results.creator_credit: Hollywood Pictures, Joe Roth, Roger Birnbaum and Jon Turteltaub
results.brief_description: Lucy (Sandra Bullock), a young subway ticket collector spends her days fantasising about one of her regular commuters, Peter (Peter Gallagher). One day fate intervenes when Lucy witnesses Peter being mugged at the station and tossed on to the tracks. Saving him from near death, Lucy gets Peter to hospital where through a misunderstanding his family assume that Lucy is Peter’s fiancee. However the plot takes a further turn when Lucy finds herself attracted to Peter’s brother Jack (Bill Pullman). A charming romantic screwball comedy. Cast also includes Peter Boyle, Glynis Johns, Micole Mercurio, Jack Warden.

results.title: While the city sleeps
results.creator_credit: RKO Radio Pictures, Burt Friedlob and Fritz Lang
results.brief_description: The editorship of a major city newspaper comes to rest upon the search for a psychopathic murderer (the “lipstick killer”). Although widely dismissed or neglected by critics, this is a film which Lang regarded as equal to his classic ‘M’. Thematically it bears comparison in the implication that socially acceptable levels of society are little different from the noir underworld. The murderer is more sympathetic than the newspaper people. There are also explicit parallels between the murderer and the ‘hero’ played by Dana Andrews, who at one stage uses his girlfriend as ‘bait’ for the killer. Stylistically this is Lang at his most lucidly refined. Cast includes Dana Andrews, George Sanders, Rhonda Fleming, George Sanders, Vincent Price and Ida Lupino. Based on the novel “The Bloody Spur” by Charles Einstein.

results.title: Which is my world?
results.brief_description: Shows how our demand for new things leads us to discard still usable items, how materials are consumed or permanently altered, and how the altered materials lie in mounds that scar our environment.

results.title: Whether to tell the truth
results.creator_credit: Columbia Pictures, Learning Corporation of America, Sam Spiegel and Elia Kazan
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Searching for values: a film anthology”.
Specially edited from “On the Waterfront”, produced by Sam Spiegel, directed by Elia Kazan, this film explores the theme of conscience and conflicting loyalties. It tells of a young man who painfully gains a sense of himself and of his duty to society at the cost of losing his friends and a familiar way of life. As a dock worker, Terry Malloy is bribed by his bosses to suppress information about the murder of a co-worker in which he had inadvertently taken part. Influenced by the parish priest and his own conscience he makes testimony and is left an outcast by his fellow workers. Based on the novel by Budd Schulberg. Suitable for middle and upper secondary level.

results.title: Wherever you go there's radio
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Researchers”.
A short film which profiles the work done at the Parkes Radio Telescope in Western Australia, particularly focussing on the public display there.

results.title: Wherever she goes
results.creator_credit: Faun Films and Michael S. Gordon
results.brief_description: A film biography of Eileen Joyce, the celebrated Australian pianist concentrating on her childhood in the Tasmanian bush and the Kalgoorlie goldfields. Opening and closing scenes show the pianist herself performing at a concert. Made in Australia by the British Production House Ealing Studios.
